data.description: Title:Data Science InternProgram SummaryKBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives. Our Colorado Springs, CO Cygnet Heights office is an integration, development and sustainment facility that provides solutions for our customers with safety and quality at the forefront of our operations.Why Join KBR?· Mentorship from senior engineers· Cutting edge projects, relevant to real world challenges· Work in a collaborative and dynamic team environment· Competitive pay and great company cultureJob SummaryKBR is seeking a Configuration Management (CM) Intern to join our team at our Colorado Springs, CO Cygnet Heights office. The selected candidate will operate under the direct supervision of a CM and support projects around ground-based mobile satellite communication systems and radio frequency engineering. The CM Intern will receive direct mentorship in being able to plan and integrate technical data and structures into a Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) Tool. This position will apply principles and techniques of CM to support engineering and drafting on project.Roles and Responsibilities· Assist in reviewing and preparing data for integration into PLM Tool· Apply CM principles in areas of engineering structures· Validate internal and vendor part numbers· Provide latest versions of documents and drawings for engineering· Review document formatting, spelling and grammar· Communicate and collaborate with other engineering disciplines, manufacturing personnel, management, vendors, customers, and subcontractors.· Support engineering documentation, i.e., drawings, project specifications, procedures, test data and results· Abide by company policies and procedures to complete assigned tasks· Must hold a valid driver’s license and have the ability to obtain a US DOD security clearanceBasic Qualifications· Must be a U.S. citizen and have valid documentation· Must be currently enrolled at, or have recently graduated from, an ABET accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelor’s of Science.Preferred Qualifications· Basic knowledge of Configuration Management and PLM tools· Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills· Able to work a minimum of 20 hours per weekSalary Range: $20-$30/hrThe salary range posted is based on Colorado Springs, CO. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.KBR BenefitsKBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.Belong, Connect and Grow at KBRAt KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.
responsibilities: We Are a Team of Teams – We have a will to succeed, but we value the achievements of our team of teams over individual accomplishments. Our collective focus makes us a better, stronger, more effective company.
